author: AccessWDUN staff
title: Roof tosses 3 TDs to lead Buford rout of Monroe Area
text:
Saturday October 17th, 2015 3:27AM Posted 8:55AM on Saturday 17th October 2015 ( 5 hours from now ) Roof tosses 3 TDs to lead Buford rout of Monroe Area Buford defenders smother a Monroe Area ball carrier in the Wolves' win on Friday in Buford. photo: David McGregor Related Articles 2015 High school football rankings 2015 High School Football region standings WEEK 8: Surprises abound in wild night of prep football VIDEO: Rabun County routs Union County in top 10 showdown, 49-3 
BUFORD -- Class AAAA third-ranked Buford held Monroe Area to just nine yards of total offense and just one first down in a 51-0 shutout in Region 8-AAAA play Friday night at Tom Riden Stadium. 
The Wolves (6-1, 4-0 Region 8-AAAA) held the Purple Hurricanes (2-5, 1-3) to minus-30 yards rushing while piling 201 yards on the ground of their own. 
However, junior quarterback Mic Roof helped seal the win with three second quarter touchdown passes. Roof connected on a 21-yard pass to Anthony Grant, a 3-yard scoring pass to Caleb Auer, and a 2-yard touchdown pass to Joshua Blackwell to push a 21-0 lead to 41-0 by halftime. 
Roof finished 10-for-13 for 154 yards and the three touchdowns passing for the game, which all came in the first half. 
Martin Mangram gave Buford a quick 7-0 lead on a 3-yard scoring run and Grant followed later in the first quarter on a 1-yard touchdown run for a 14-0. Cooper Simpson scored on a 20-yard run early in the second quarter for a 21-0 lead. 
In the third quarter, Da’Mario Lott pushed Buford’s lead to 48-0 on a 2-yard run and junior kicker Daniel Garcia capped the scoring with a 36-yard field goal in the fourth quarter. 
The Wolves will play host to North Oconee next week. Associated Categories : Friday Game Night, High School Sports , Sports Associated Tags : High school football, Buford football © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
